results.title: Mother
results.creator_credit: Jannas Quayle, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jannas Quayle pays tribute to her mother, a lady of great strength and warmth who has watched over her family and kept them together, depsite life sending them to different places.

results.title: Ribbon of life: one man's reef
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Elizabeth Parer-Cook, Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia) and Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
results.brief_description: Alastair Birtles, marine biologist, recounts his journeys of discovery through the mountains of coral of the Great Barrier Reef. Shows how the reef mountains grow, how islands are born, how the reef is a vast living system that is constantly growing, dying and growing again while facing serious threats from man. Brilliant underwater sequences filmed and directed by award winning film-maker David Parer capture the private lives of the creatures inhabiting the coral forests. Densey Clyne contributes on the minute details of the reef’s underwater life.

results.title: Rhythmetron: with the Dance Theatre of Harlem and Arthur Mitchell
results.creator_credit: Milton A. Fruchtman and Capital Cities
results.brief_description: Arthur Mitchell, a leading black dancer, talks about the founding of the Dance Theatre of Harlem in 1970. He speaks of his own struggle for recognition in the white world of ballet. The Company dances parts of three ballets: ‘Fete Noire’, ‘Biosfera’ and ‘Rhythmetron’. Choreography by Arthur Mitchell.
results.title_for_label: Rhythmetron: with the Dance Theatre of Harlem and Arthur Mitchell

results.title: Rice Growing in the Riverina = Irrigation farming in the Riverina
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Year round activity on the rice farms of the Riverina where rice is grown under irrigation in rotation with wheat, oats and fodder and sheep and cattle are also run. Sheep are sheared in August and during this time of the year the land is cultivated for the summer rice crop. Harvesting of the rice is done by contract when the rice ripens after five months and the rice is then processed at the co-operatively owned mill.

results.title: Revenge of a kinematograph cameraman
results.creator_credit: Ladislas Starevich and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Provides an example of an early animated puppet film by Ladislas Starevich, a young Polish artist, who gained international recognition for his pioneering work in animated and trick films. Starevich worked at one time for the Khanzhonkov, a Russian studio, but later emigrated to Paris. His work had a light, satirical touch, which in those days, was almost unique among Russian film-makers. Also known as ‘The Cameraman’s Revenge’ Mrs Beetle is involved with a grasshopper artist while Mr Beetle is seeing a dragonfly cabaret performer! An intricate drama of (f)lies, deceit and the just revenge of the cinematographer. One of Starewicz earlier films, possibly the very first cinematic treatment of insect fidelity.

results.title: Return to the sea: a saga of survival
results.creator_credit: Ian McFadyen, Martin McGrath and Comedia
results.brief_description: A humorous parody of David Attenborough’s “Life on earth” documentaries. Our suburban mode of existence with its annual return to the beach resorts is likened to the ritualistic behaviour of members of the animal kingdom. Raises issues about the way we define the behaviour of cultures different from our own. Contains an early performance by Steve Vizard.
results.title_for_label: Return to the sea: a saga of survival
results.description: A humorous parody of David Attenborough’s “Life on earth” documentaries. results.title: Return to Sandakan
results.creator_credit: Raymond Quint, Film Australia National Interest Program and Japan Foundation
results.brief_description: During World War II, Sandakan prisoner of war camp in British North Borneo held nearly 2,500 Allied prisoners. By war’s end, only six survived. The story of the atrocities committed by the Japanese at Sandakan is one of the grimmest of the Pacific War. Shot in Australia, Malaysia and Japan, this documentary recounts the tragic story of prisoners of war and examines the legacy of these events for survivors and their families. Some of the images in this program may be disturbing to some viewers.

results.title: Return to Evercreech Junction. All change at Evercreech Junction. The friendly line to Burnham.
results.brief_description: For most passengers, a trip on the Somerset and Dorset, (affectionately known as the ‘Slow and Dirty’), meant seaside holidyas. It ran from Bath, up over Mendip Hills, before dropping down to Evercreech, the junction for Burnham-On-Sea, and onto Bournemouth. Before its unexpected closure in 1966, the Somerset and Dorset was filmed in colour by railway enthusiast, Ivo Peters of Bath. This is a vivid record of the steam age and the railwaymen who worked on the line

results.title: Rhino christmas
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, Fiona Cochrane, Armstrong and Cochrane Productions
results.brief_description: It’s a hot and boringly predictable Christmas Day in the suburbs and Mott wishes it would snow. She’s sick of presents that are educational and of going to the beach with her new-age parents who meditate all day. But then weird things happen in this off beat fantasy.
